definition: right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
ancient name for go (Chinese board game)

sentences.english: Vision system of Chinese chess playing robot is the key part.
sentences.chinese: 視覺系統是仿人對弈機器人研究的關鍵部分。

sentences.english: Like a game of chess, with the future of the planet as the stakes on the table.
sentences.chinese: 就像象棋對弈，在桌子上位這個星球的未來博弈。

sentences.english: Game has gone, who will care about weigh and a plate of CanQi in addition to the world of mortals?
sentences.chinese: 對弈的人已走，誰還在意推敲紅塵之外的一盤殘棋？

sentences.english: He let the prince have first move. Haldon stood behind them, watching the play.
sentences.chinese: 他讓王子先走，哈爾頓在身後看着他們對弈。

sentences.english: This paper will introduce how to realize a Chinese Chess program.
sentences.chinese: 本文將介紹如何實現一款中國象棋對弈程序。

sentences.english: In my opinion, Go is a game on the two players' intelligence and psychology.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，下圍棋的過程是對弈雙方心智博弈的過程。

definition: writing on the ground with a large brush dipped in water
to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
kifu (record of a game of go or shogi)
elevated stage on which martial competitions or duels were held/arena/ring
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
to fight with all one's might
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
